runs.comm: a quick, sharp bouncer! That was seriously lively! Absolutely flew through to the keeper
another good one, more prodigious bounce - we saw plenty for the women's final a few hours ago, remember - and he cuts it, jumping back onto the tips of his toes and cutting it late
the third short ball in succession and he goes back, playing it very late - later than he'd have liked, I think. He's quite slippery, Aamer, and is certainly hurrying Dilshan
that could have gone anywhere! Went for a pull, it came off his body then via his bat and could easily have looped through to the keeper!
goddim! He's out! Dilshan departs for a duck as he goes for that flicky pull-cum-scoop but mistimes it for once, and short fine-leg scurries to his left to take a fine catch
another short ball but quite nicely timed to backward point. A wicket-maiden in the final of the World Twenty20 - well, who'd have predicted that? Fantastic over by Aamer - just 17-years-old
cuts off the seam and bobbles off his pads to the leg side, and they steal a run. Younis isn't happy about it, angrily shouting at someone - Razzaq I think.
edged just wide of the first slip - more prodigious bounce takes a thick outside edge of this good, off-stump line

got him! Pakistan have two! He came skipping down the wicket and tried to whip it through midwicket but the bounce did for him, and he got a leading edge to mid-off who steadied himself to take an easy catch
calmly defended to leg
a fuller delivery flicked to leg. Neatly timed and in fact they'll get two

on the off stump and he's got four through midwicket. Plenty of bottom hand in that stroke - a real shovel, a heave through the leg side. Not the prettiest of shots, but it's four nonetheless and four very important runs
worked to the off side. Calmly played
again Aamer bangs this in short and Sangakkara shuffles back, punching out to the off side
short and pulled through midwicket. This could be four, the outfield is so quick here at this time of the year - and yes, it races for four, Sangakkara's first
wonderful shot! Pure elegance and orthodoxy from Sangakkara. Wide and full enough to drive, so he just leant on it for four through extra cover
better. Back of a length, forcing him onto the back foot and he defends to point. Sharper, sparkier delivery
neatly defended to point
brilliant! A short-arm pull is absolutely drilled, right out of the screws and right into the Mound stand at midwicket!
four more. Fuller from Razzaq, but his line is all wrong and Jayasuriya whips it from leg-stump down to fine leg. A real shovel, that stroke, but taking advantage of the misdirected line
slower ball - 70.8mph - guided out to the off side
short of a length and slower in pace, he nearly puts the batsman in two minds as he tries to pull but doesn't commit fully to the stroke, the ball meekly working its way to mid-on
bowled him! And Razzaq slips and is on the floor! On the off stump, Jayasuriya went for another shovel-pull but dragged it on to the delight of Pakistan. They have three!
outside the off stump, he goes back and guides it out to the off side
it's a little too straight and worked to leg with a flick of the wrists. Nicely played
short and again too straight, allowing him to pull it through midwicket - though without the power he would've wanted, so they only grab a single
oh that's good cricket by this pair, Jayawardene prodding it out to the off side and stealing a sharp single
short of a length and goodish pace - 82mph: quick enough - and it's defended on the back foot
again, nice line just outside off and too short to drive. Prodded off the back foot out to the off side
fuller, but still short of a length, and prodded to mid-off for a strike-retaining single
on the middle stump, flicked to leg with wristy intent
stroked out to the off side
gone! Fourth wicket falls as Jayawardene attempts a cute back-cut but guides it straight into the gleeful hands of slip, who swallows it to his right with ease. Pakistan on fire!
fine ball on the off stump - good first delivery, that. No great pace, but no need for lightning pace when they're this accurate. Solidly blocked
steps across to the off side and works it to mid-on
Sangakkara steps to the off side, whipping it off his leg stump. Dangerous tactic, but he does look in good nick and times it nicely
starts with one just outside off and it's carefully chopped to third man
flighted just outside the off stump and defended out to the off side
a touch of drift in the air but Sangakkara prods it out to the off side and they steal a single
short of a length, he skips down the pitch and flicks him to leg
press forward - Duncan Fletcher would be so proud - and drops it out to the off side
quicker ball, and extreme drift into the right-hander - the mark of a really gifted leg-spinner. Bat-padded out to the off side
flattish and punched out to the off side. They think of two, but Sangakkara sends him back. A run-out is not what Sri Lanka need, frankly
flat and straight, nudged to the leg side
a touch of drift away from the right-hander, as is the off-spinner's wont, and it's cautiously defended out to the off side
ooh, so close! Tossed up a little wider and it beats his loose drive. That was mighty, mighty close
well, I think that's well played rather than edging it. Outside off and he opens the face, taking it out of the keeper's gloves. I'll give him the benefit of the doubt on that
slightly squared up, driving out to mid-off
down on one knee and slapped to cover. Timed the underwear off that
outside off, pushed to cover
nearly slips here, skipping outside leg and flicking to mid-on
good length, dropped it a little shorter as he saw him coming charging down the pitch. That's intelligent stuff from Afridi
how did that not bowl him! A quicker ball scurries through his pads and Akmal takes it behind the batsman's legs to his left! Mighty close
shorter ball is cut out to point but only for a single
swept off middle stump
outside off, whipped to short fine-leg but they do get a single
slog-swept and he'll get four! Deep midwicket and deep square-leg converge from opposite directions - this could be entertaining! - but midwicket misses it and it's four
skipped down the pitch and clipped to mid-on
beaten! Lovely delivery bounces and turns away from the left-hander. That was seriously close and a top, top delivery
flipped to leg. Flatter delivery
flicked to leg
on his legs and turned to the leg side
faster ball, 59mph, and Afridi demands this is given out. But the batsman came charging down the pitch
oh what a stroke that is. Stands tall, steps back to the leg side and strokes it beautifully through extra cover for four. What placement
another shout for lbw as Sangakkara sweeps this - and he's got bat on it, too. Good over for Sri Lanka; Sangakkara's beginning to motor here
on middle, tucked to leg for another single and he steals the strike
on middle stump, Sangakkara drops it out to the off side and he really needs to get his skates on! And he does
that'll be a wide. A fat one it was too - miles wide of the off stump
ooh and he feels for this just outside off! Not a great deal of movement - just a little bit of nibble away from the right-hander
got him! Gul makes the breakthrough, whacking it in short and Silva tried to pull but completely mistimed it, the ball looping meekly to midwicket
pushed out to the off side
quicker ball outside off and he plays and misses, feeling for it outside off! Sri Lanka look overawed and nervous, as well they might be at 67 for 5
another swing and a miss outside off
tossed up on the off stump, clamps forward to defend
nudged out to the off side
fuller and faster and pushed hard, powerfully, to mid-off
back of a length, turning back sharply on the off stump and guided out to the off side
back-cut out to point
bowled him! Brilliant delivery drifting back sharply, beating his drive and the wrong'un skittles him. Outstanding from Afridi!
pushed out to the off side
fuller, faster, clipped to leg. Akmal screams at Ajmal to get the ball in back in time. He's on fire, Akmal - tremendous noise all afternoon.
clipped to short midwicket
good line on middle-and-leg, turned to the leg side
dances down the pitch to make it into a full toss before whipping it to leg
good delivery but he turns it down to fine leg. Pakistan's won't mind the single as it keeps Sangakkara off strike
wide of the off stump and wided
mistimed - beaten for pace really - as he slices it down to third man
on the leg stump and whipped to deep midwicket. Just the single there though
pulled to short midwicket but without really timing it. It's more of a guided-pull than anything aggressive
that bent back in markedly on the right-hander, at 86mph, and again appeared to trouble him for pace off the pitch. It's hurriedly turned to square leg
down the pitch, driving to long-off but again for just a single
on the off stump and again Gul gives him absolutely no width to play with. It's defended to leg
worked to deep midwicket
skips down the pitch and tries to whack it to long-on
down the pitch and clatters it over midwicket, scurrying runs as though their lives depend on it. Akmal goes berserk behind the stumps
flicked to leg - fine leg clears up and they scurry for two
shorter delivery, slapped over the top. It appears mistimed - it's more of a wellied shot - but in fact he's placed it perfectly for two
swept crisply but without the placement
and there is his fifty from 44 balls as he clips this beautifully over midwicket off his toes. Top knock
attempts a pull but gets all tangled up, the ball squirting out to the off side
opens himself up and slices it out to deep extra cover. Nice shot, and the placement is good enough to grab two
fuller delivery whipped to leg
full toss - very full indeed. Waist-height
pulled to midwicket
good shot! Top shot to a poor delivery, pulling this powerfully for four. Just too short from Gul
down the pitch to this good-length delivery but he can't make anything of it, defending it on the front foot
steps to leg - bowler sees this and fires it in flat on the off stump, to which he cuts and nearly chops it on
elegant flick to short fine-leg to get Sangakkara back on strike
shot! Brilliant stroke, taking a big step down the wicket and fairly slapping this wide of long-on for four. Powerfully struck
he's timed the lacquer off this! But straight to deep square leg
superb shot down the ground, and Sri Lanka's dug-out look a much happier camp. Wonderful shot, skipping down the ground and on-driving powerfully
Sangakkara shows him all three stumps as he steps to leg, before squeezing it out to the off side
four! Four more! Steps to leg and leathers it massively through the leg-side, all along the ground
a bouncer pulled to deep square leg
shows all three stumps before slicing to third man
brilliant yorker! Mathews can't do anything with that, other than clonk it back to the bowler
flayed to cover but just for a single, and Mathews is on strike for the final over. Not a bad result, that, for Pakistan
steps to leg and opens himself up, this goes miles in the air wide of mid-off. Younis gives chase but can't quite pull off a catch - good effort though!
short, wide and sliced for four to third man! No stopping that! That's absolutely shot for four
what a shot! A monstrous, massive heave over midwicket for the tournament's 162nd six. He absolutely nailed that!
better and fuller, pulled from outside off to long-on for a single to get Sangakkara back on strike. No! They take two. Well clearly Kumar's happy with Mathews in this kind of form, and why not?
full, nearly a yorker, and pumped to mid-on. A rapid throw nearly flies for overthrows, but it's cleaned up
nice and full and smudged through midwicket
